situation.title: Traveling to/from Great Britain and Northern Ireland from December 20, 2020 onwards
situation.meta_description: Povinnosti osob, které cestují z/do Velké Británie a Severního Irska.

content.processed:
All persons, who have after 3:30pm on December 20, 2020, entered the Czech Republic and came after an at least 14-day stay from Great Britain or Northern Ireland, are obliged

  • to isolate themselves at home. The isolation has to last either 10 days or until a PCR test carried out at least 5 days after entering the Czech Republic turns a negative result. The test result must be presented to the passenger's nearest regional public health office.

This measure aims to improve safety of the citizens. It is an extraordinary measure imposed due to a novel, high contagious mutation of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which has lately emerged in the UK. In order to stop its spread and protect people living here, a rapid reaction is necessary.

During your isolation, please behave considerately. Provided you need to do your everyday essentials (buying groceries, caring your children or pets, using financial & postal services etc.), you are allowed to leave your home. Please, however, avoid peak times at stores, offices etc. and adhere strictly to the "3Z rule".

Starting at 12:00pm December 21, 2020, no direct flights between the Great Britain/the Northern Ireland and the Czech Republic are allowed anymore. This applies until further notice, however, no longer than until December 31, 11:59pm, except for ambulance, evacuation and life-saving flights.

Please be careful, as it is not known yet, to which extent exactly the novel SARS-CoV-2 mutation is more contagious. You may spread the virus even if you don't show any symptoms of the disease.
